alert.note: Alert for San Luis Obispo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 20 at 12:17PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including the following county, Western and Central San Luis Obispo. * WHEN...Until 400 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1214 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding has already been reported in the advisory area, around Pismo Beach. Between 0.3 and 0.6 inch of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Luis Obispo, Paso Robles, Morro Bay, Pismo Beach, Atascadero, Arroyo Grande, Nipomo, Cambria, Grover Beach, Highway 101 over Cuesta Grade, Santa Margarita, Templeton, Baywood-Los Osos, Cayucos, Avila Beach, Diablo Canyon, Shell Beach, Lake Lopez, Oceano and San Miguel. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
